author: The Wall Street Journal
description:
President Trump has shown the U.S. can use lethal force to combat drug cartels in Venezuela and has repeatedly tied Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro to drug trafficking. The U.S. military carried out a strike against a drug-carrying boat from Venezuela killing eleven just days after the Pentagon deployed warships to the Caribbean to stop the flow of cocaine. 

WSJ’s Vera Bergengruen explains how the heightened rhetoric and military moves by the Trump administration and Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro could escalate.

Chapters:
0:00 U.S.-Venezuela tension
0:42 Trump’s crackdown on drug cartels
3:21 Pressure on Maduro

News Explainers
Some days the high-speed news cycle can bring more questions than answers. WSJ’s news explainers break down the day's biggest stories into bite-size pieces to help you make sense of the news.

#Trump #Venezuela #WSJ
title: How Trump’s Strikes on Venezuelan Boats Could Spark Armed Conflict | WSJ

author: The Wall Street Journal
description:

title: Tracking ICE Arrests Under Trump’s Second Presidency
